tit.cmt: Maejima Wharf と統一しました。

sen.j: 前島埠頭（まえじまふとう）は、京都府舞鶴市にある舞鶴港の埠頭。
sen.e: Maejima-futo Pier is located in Maizuru-ko Port in Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture..
Maejima-futo Pier is located in Maizuru-ko Port in Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture..
Maejima Wharf is located in Maizuru Port in Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: Maejima Wharf、Maizuru Port としました。

sen.j: 埠頭の埠の字が常用漢字に含まれないため、看板などには「前島ふ頭」と記されている事もある。
sen.e: Since 埠 in 埠頭 is not included in the Chinese characters designated for everyday use, 前島ふ頭 instead of 前島埠頭 is sometimes used, for example, on signboards.
Since 埠 in 埠頭 is not included in the Chinese characters designated for everyday use, the characters 前島ふ頭 instead of 前島埠頭 are sometimes used, for example, on signboards.
Since 埠 in 埠頭 is not included in the Chinese characters designated for everyday use, the characters 前島ふ頭 instead of 前島埠頭 are sometimes used, for example, on signboards.

sen.j: 舞鶴港は近畿地方の日本海側における玄関港として発展した港湾で、1970年（昭和45年）より北海道小樽市の小樽港とを直結する長距離フェリー航路が開設されている。
sen.e: Maizuru-ko Port has developed as the main port for the Kinki region on the Japan Sea side, and a long-distance direct ferry route has been operated since 1970 between this port and Otaru-ko Port in Otaru City, Hokkaido Prefecture.

Maizuru-ko Port was developed as the main port for the Kinki region on the Japan Sea side, and a long-distance direct ferry route has operated since 1970 between this port and Otaru-ko Port in Otaru City, Hokkaido Prefecture.

Maizuru Port was developed as the main port for the Kinki region on the Japan Sea side, and a long-distance direct ferry route has operated since 1970 between this port and Otaru Port in Otaru City, Hokkaido Prefecture.

sen.j: 当初は舞鶴西港に発着していたが、増大する輸送力に対応するため、1990年（平成2年）舞鶴東港に国内貿易の拠点埠頭として整備されたのが、前島埠頭である。
sen.e: Initially, the ferry arrived at and departed from Maizuru Nishi-ko Port, but, to copy with the situation that increasing more cargoes had been transported through the port, Maejima-futo Pier was constructed in Maizuru Higashi-ko Port in 1970 as a core pier for domestic trade.

Initially, the ferry arrived at and departed from Maizuru Nishi-ko Port. The Maejima-futo Pier was constructed in Maizuru Higashi-ko Port in 1970 as a core pier for domestic trade and to cope with increased transportation occuring in Maizuru Nishi-ko Port.

Initially, the ferry arrived at and departed from Maizuru-Nishi Port (Maizuru West Port); Maejima Wharf was constructed in Maizuru-Higashi Port (Maizuru East Port) in 1990 as a core wharf for domestic trade and to cope with increased transportation occurring in Maizuru-Nishi Port.
sen.cmt: 舞鶴西港、東港、なとの表現を変更しました。年号、スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 現在、舞鶴港と小樽港を結ぶ大型フェリーが週7便、就航しており、近畿と北海道を結ぶ大動脈として利用されている。
sen.e: At present, big-sized ferries voyage seven times a week between Maizuru-ko Port and Otaru-ko Port, playing the role of an artery between the Kinki region and Hokkaido.
At present,large ferries voyaged seven times a week between Maizuru-ko Port and Otaru-ko Port, acting as a focal point between the Kinki region and Hokkaido.
At present, large ferries voyage seven times a week between Maizuru Port and Otaru Port, acting as a focal point between the Kinki region and Hokkaido.
sen.cmt: 時制を修正、地名表現を修正しました。

sen.j: また南側岸壁は耐震構造を備えており、非常時の物資輸送にも対応できるようになっている。
sen.e: The quay on the south side is provided with an earthquake-proof structure, enabling transportation of goods to be handled there in emergencies.
The quay on the south side is provided with an earthquake-proof structure, enabling goods to be transported during emergencies.
The quay on the south side is provided with an earthquake-proof structure, enabling goods to be transported during emergencies.

sen.j: なお、フェリーの大型化に対応した拡張計画もある。
sen.e: A plan to expand the pier also exists for dealing with the tendency that the size of the ferries has become increasing larger.
Due to the increasing size of ferries, a plan has been formulated to expand the pier.
Due to the increasing size of ferries, a plan has been formulated to expand the wharf.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 舞鶴若狭自動車道・舞鶴東インターチェンジから国道27号経由で約7km。
sen.e: Use of the Maizuru Wakasa expressway: an approx. 7 km from the Maizuru Higashi interchange via national road 27
Using the Maizuru Wakasa expressway: approx. 7 km from the Maizuru Higashi interchange via National Road 27
Using the Maizuru Wakasa Expressway: approx. seven km from the Maizuru Higashi Interchange via National Route 27
sen.cmt: 地名表現を修正しました。数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.e: (Approx. 15 minutes by car)
(Approx. 15 minutes by car)
(Approx. fifteen minutes by car)
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 西日本旅客鉄道舞鶴線・東舞鶴駅（北口）より約2.3km（タクシーで約7分）
sen.e: Use of the Maizuru Line of West Japan Railway Company: approx. 2.3 km from (the north entrance of) Higashi Maizuru Station (approx. seven minutes by taxi)
Use of the Maizuru Line of West Japan Railway Company: approx. 2.3 km from (the north entrance of) Higashi Maizuru Station (approx. seven minutes by taxi)
Use of the Maizuru Line of West Japan Railway Company: approx. 2.3 km from (the north entrance of) Higashi Maizuru Station (approx. seven minutes by taxi)

sen.j: 新日本海フェリー舞鶴支店
sen.e: The Maizuru branch office of Shin Nihonkai Ferry
